the status code of the response

getStatusLine().Description: Obtains the status line of this response. The status line can be set using one of the @B_org#apache#http#HttpResponse#setStatusLine_E@ methods, or it can be initialized in a constructor.

getProtocolVersion().Description: Returns the protocol version this message is compatible with.

setStatusCode(int).Description: Updates the status line of this response with a new status code. The status line can only be updated if it is available. It must have been set either explicitly or in a constructor. The reason phrase will be updated according to the new status code, based on the current @B_org#apache#http#HttpResponse#getLocale_E@. It can be set explicitly using @B_org#apache#http#HttpResponse#setReasonPhrase_E@.

BasicHttpResponse(org.apache.http.Status.Description: Creates a response from a status line. The response will not have a reason phrase catalog and use the system default locale.

Parameters: the entity to associate with this response, or null to unset
setEntity(org.apache.http.HttpEntity).Description: Associates a response entity with this response.

Returns: the locale of this response, never null
getLocale().Description: Obtains the locale of this response. The locale is used to determine the reason phrase for the @B_org#apache#http#HttpResponse#setStatusCode_E@. It can be changed using @B_org#apache#http#HttpResponse#setLocale_E@.

Parameters: the status line of this response
setStatusLine(org.apache.http.StatusLine.Description: Sets the status line of this response.

Returns: the response entity, or null if there is none
getEntity().Description: Obtains the message entity of this response, if any. The entity is provided by calling @B_org#apache#http#HttpResponse#setEntity_E@.

setLocale(java.util.Locale).Description: Changes the locale of this response. If there is a status line, it's reason phrase will be updated according to the status code and new locale.

ClassDesc: Please use @B_java#net#URL#openConnection_E@ instead. Please visit Basic implementation of an HTTP response that can be modified. This implementation makes sure that there always is a status line.
